DataElement.preferredName: Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Not Reason ISO21090.DSET.SC.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action within the context of a given study that is not directly related to the study's overarching hypothesis evaluation or testing, but is nonetheless essential to the efficient and/or effective coordination and execution of the study. EXAMPLE(S): assignment to a treatment arm, registration to a study, start of on-study period, end of on-study period, obtain informed consent, verify eligibility criteria, enroll, randomize, complete study visits, exit study, break treatment blind, protocol violation, premature withdrawal, etc. The text and/or code that describes why an activity did not occur. EXAMPLE(S): forgot to ask, sample lost.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Not Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._Not; used for negation of a word or group of words.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
